item.title: The Key KPIs Every Sales Team Should Track to Drive Growth
item.description:
Tracking the right KPIs is critical to driving growth, improving decision-making, and ensuring sales teams stay on track to meet organizational goals. Without the proper metrics, it’s easy to lose sight of performance and miss out on potential revenue opportunities. Below, we’ll explore the most important KPIs every sales team should monitor and how they contribute to success.

1. Lead Conversion Rate

This KPI measures the percentage of leads that turn into actual customers. By tracking conversion rates, sales teams can identify where prospects drop off in the sales funnel and optimize strategies to improve performance.
